summary: Feature request to warn developers when multiple worker processes are running on the same machine with potentially different code versions, which can cause non-deterministic task execution in development environments.
userImpact: Developers may experience confusing non-deterministic behavior when old worker processes interfere with new ones, making debugging difficult.
rootCause: Multiple worker processes running simultaneously on the same machine can pick up tasks intended for the newer worker version.
proposedFix: Add a development-time warning that searches for other worker processes on the machine and logs their PIDs with a suggestion to kill them, possibly integrated with task queue introspection via tctl API.
workaround: Manually stop any other worker processes before starting development, or use worker versioning for deployments.
resolutionDetails: Resolved as wontfix with suggestion to use worker versioning instead, which is the proper solution for managing multiple code versions.
keyQuote: There is another worker process running on this machine. If it was started with an older version of your Worker and Activity code, we recommend stopping it
